title: Sudden problem logging into Cox email with Thunderbird
content:
I've used various versions of Thunderbird for a very long time and usually it works fine. Up until a few hours ago Thunderbird was working with my Cox email account. All of a sudden I can't log in to receive my email. I checked my settings (pop.cox.net, port 995, security SSL/TLS) and they seem to be OK. I get a message back saying "authentication failed". When I have occasionally run into this problem in the past, I found that changing my Cox password resolves the problem. This time it does not work. Strangely I find that I can send an email OK with Thunderbird but I can't log in to receive. I tried calling Cox 3 times but they profess not to know what the problem is. I'm currently having to check my email using an iPhone which is not too satisfactory. 

  Any ideas as to what could be causing this?  Suggestions?
creator: gersen77

title: Archive setting to preserve folder structure doesn't work for Inbox folder
content:
When configuring the "Archive" feature, there is an option to Keep existing folder stricture of archive messages, and the Example given shows how inside the "Archives folder, there would be an Inbox folder.

However, when I tested this feature, it seems like this setting does not apply to the Inbox folder.

While this is not necessarily a bad behaviour (Inbox gets archived into the main Archive folder, while the rest get their own subfolders, but then the Example given is misleading since it uses "Inbox" as an example subfolder.

I have attached to this ticket an image showing my current archive with a mail achived from, respectively:

  • Inbox
  • Drafts
  • Junk
  • Sent

And it's clear that no Inbox folder was created.
creator: rodrigo_vda

title: yandex
content:
с почтового клиента Thundebird v.102.10 на ОС Linux Mint выходит окно яндекс почты для ввода логина и пароля, после ввода логина и пароля от Япочты, выходит окно для ввода одноразового кода с смс, ввожу и пишет ошибку "400 no redirect и прочее". Как сделать так, чтобы: 1. Проходила авторизация без ошибок? 2. В принципе не выходила авторизации при каждой отправке письма? Настройки Oauth токен на яндекс почте выполнены, создан пароль для приложения, все по инструкции, письма приходят без пароля, а отправка не идет. Удалять профиль и по-новой добавлять пробовал- не помогает. OAuth-авторизация через почтовую программу Mozilla Thunderbird сейчас недоступна — переадресация в этом клиенте настроена неверно. Этот вопрос на стороне разработчиков программы. Вы можете обратиться в их службу поддержки и попросить поправить настройки.

Пока можем предложить другой способ авторизации для Mozilla Thunderbird — по паролю приложения. Для этого нужно изменить тип аутентификации на «Обычный пароль». Подробнее о том, как это сделать, рассказали в нашей Справке. 

Но и смена на обычный пароль не помогли. При отправке просит письма просит пароль ввести, ни от яндекс почты, ни парольл приложения не подходят.
creator: user337665112596040997840372708974374893873

title: Thunderbird not responding more time than responding
content:
Hi.

I've been using TB for severeal years. Now I'm using version 102.10.1 Windows (x64), but it started freezing (not responding), after the upgrade to 102.10.1, and... after Windows 10 Enterprise upgrade 22H2.

My computer has finished downloading the 22H2 upgrade, and TB also had an information about pending update.

Windows restarted my computer while I was sleeping, and after I wake up, I've started Windows, TB and... suffering began.

It's impossible to use TB, because, it becomes not responding for a while, like a minute, then it starts responding for five or less seconds.

Sometimes, it become unresponsive for 20 or 30 seconds, then it starts responding, but always, always five or less seconds.

One thing that happened in the weekend after leaving the computer on for two days... I started responding again!! It was veeeery good! Uhulll \o/

Then I realized that only my Google Calendars (2 accounts, CalDAV) were inactive. As I wanted to plan some activities, I clicked in "activate" (or enable, I don't know exactly it is in the english version, because in Portuguese (BR) is Ativar), and then all hell breaks lose...

OMG what a regret.

There was been 3 days and Thunderbrid never got better again. The "Not Responding" is back. Like Terminator or Freddy Krueger. It's an endless nightmare.

I've already restarted Windows, unplugged network, restarted Thunderbird and nothing happens...

Now it came to stay. Worst than my mother in law doing a suprise visit to stay for the week.

Help me please.
creator: alexanderscouto

title: Thunderbird Help for Bird Brain
content:
Want to preface this with: I am not very techy besides what I can YouTube.

Backstory: I left a nonprofit job of 10 years where there was no IT policy and I had a bunch of personal documents/emails on the account. I downloaded the emails to Thunderbird and cleared my inbox. 45 days later, after missing the window to retrieve emails from the gmail server, the boss emailed me threatening to sue me. I am trying to get the emails back to the org's gmail without luck. I'm using a macbook air.

What I've done/checked: Opening up Thunderbird from Applications, ports and IMAP/POP/OAuth2 stuff seems to match. I've tried copying the emails (they are in the Local Folders, and there are 49,500 emails) without any luck; I've added another gmail just for the transfer to see whether the org server was preventing the downloads, but even with a brand new gmail it won't copy more than 3,000 emails before it stops working. 

Questions: 1) It seems that given the large volume of emails something (maybe gmail) is preventing the emails from being copied back into the org email (or really any gmail). Is there a way to fix this?

2) Is there another way I can share/copy the emails via some other device/program that will allow the org to read and access the emails (i.e, external hard drive, but not sure what format the export would need to be for them to be able to access/read the emails?)

3) Last resort: is there a way to make an account/profile in Thunderbird that will allow my boss to access the one Local Folder on her own laptop, without having access to the other emails on my Thunderbird account? I tried making a profile but it just asked for a new email and didn't give me the option of selecting accessibility. 

Appreciate any help as I'm totally lost, thanks!
creator: magdalenak.mft

title: Allegato mancante se bozza chiusa in particolare condizione
content:
Con le ultime versioni di Thunderbird (sicuramente 102.10.1 e 102.11.0) accade che, aprendo una seconda email, trascinando l'allegato dentro alla nuova email e poi chiudendo la prima email, il file allegato non risulti più disponibile (OS: Windows 10).

Come replicare il problema: 1) Con Esplora File, aprire il percorso c:\users\*nome_utente*\AppData\Local\Temp\moz_mapi\ 2) copiare un file PDF qualsiasi nel suddetto percorso (tale copia è in seguito chiamata copy.pdf) 3) tasto destro del mouse su copy.pdf, selezionare "Invia a"; si apre la finestra di composizione con il PDF già allegato. Si noti che nella cartella ".......\moz_mapi" è stata creata un'ulteriore copia di copy.pdf e che è questa copia ad essere stata allegata (in seguito chiamata tmp.pdf). 4) In Thunderbird selezionare "Scrivi" per aprire la seconda finestra di composizione 5) Trascinare l'allegato dalla prima finestra alla seconda finestra di composizione 6) Chiudere la prima finestra di composizione e attendere qualche secondo; Si noti che nella cartella ".......\moz_mapi" è scomparso il file tmp.pdf 7) Risulta ora impossibile salvare la bozza o inviare l'email perché compare l'errore "Impossibile salvare il messaggio come bozza. Si è verificato un errore nell’allegare copy.pdf. Controllare di disporre dei permessi per accedere al file."
creator: stefanpoz

title: Auto Delete Emails
content: Hi, I have been a Thunderbird user for over twenty years. I access my emails on the following devices - Desktop - Thunderbird (POP3) Phone - App (Imap) Webmail - Imap In early April, my Webmail account sync with my phone and I lost my folders and emails on my webmail (Bigpond) account. Currently, when I access my emails from the phone app or webmail, the emails stays however as soon as I open Thunderbird on my desktop, the emails download from the server and auto deletes all emails on my phone and webmail Inbox. If I move an email to a folder on the phone, it is not deleted. I can send emails. I have sought help from the app developer and the network provider (Bigpond) and they advised that they have never come across such issue. The tech people have gone through all the settings and unable to find the problem. I was just wondering if anyone may have had a similar issue recently and found a solution. Would appreciate any help as it is driving me crazy. Thank you.
